title: What are some mistakes needed to avoid when writing a resume as a software engineer? - Quora
tags: Jobs and Careers in Software Engineering

response.answer_text: Not applicable to everyone, but took me a long time to realize. Don’t just have one version of your resume for every job you apply to. Companies call different roles different things and don’t always abide by the commonly accepted definition of particular roles. This is especially true for data roles. I’ve seen “Data Scientist” used to describe everything from a Machine Learning expert to a BA who knows SQL. Debates aside of what “should” be considered a Data Scientist or not, you should tailor your resume to the role and THEIR expectations, not yours. Personally, I keep a base resume with my relevant experience and then adapt my title and skills based on what I’m applying to. If it’s a data heavy role, I’ll mention my data related skills. If it’s a software heavy role, I’ll mention my software skills early on. As long as you feel it’s a good role for you, use their language and apply with the relevant resume.
